title: BWS is giving away rare six-packs for NOTHING
text:
BWS is giving away free six-packs of some of the world's rarest beer.

The store polled thousands of Australians and travelled across the world to deliver 'the rarest six-pack on Earth'.

Australians in Sydney, Perth, Melbourne and Brisbane have the chance to pick up a free six-pack on October 18 from 10am.

Australians in Sydney, Perth, Melbourne and Brisbane have the chance to pick up a free six-pack on October 18 from 10am (stock)

However the offer is only while stocks last.

The six-pack includes Weizen, a fruity beer from Japan, and Bhutanese Red Rice Larger from Bhutan.

There are also beers from Germany, Poland, Mexico and Italy.

The beer from Italy, called Barrel Aged Saison, is aged for seven months. About 60 per cent of it is brewed in Scotch whisky barrels and 40 per cent in Caroni rum barrels.

The offer is available at Sydney's Balmain store, Perth's Wembley, Melbourne's Brunswick and Brisbane's Ashgrove stores.

The range will be available in all stores from October 18.

The six-pack includes Weizen, a fruity beer from Japan, and Bhutanese Red Rice Larger from Bhutan
description: The store polled thousands of Australians and travelled across the world to deliver 'the rarest six-pack on Earth'.
authors: Claudia Poposki For Daily Mail Australia
